definition: Amazon EC2 (Elastic Compute Cloud) provides secure, resizable compute capacity in the cloud.
Amazon S3 (Simple Storage Service) is an object storage service that offers scalability, data availability, and security.
AWS Lambda lets you run code without provisioning or managing servers.
Amazon DynamoDB is a fast, flexible NoSQL database service for any scale.
AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) enables secure access to AWS services and resources.
Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) lets you provision a logically isolated section of the AWS Cloud.
Amazon Route 53 is a scalable DNS and domain name registration service.
Amazon CloudFront is a content delivery network (CDN) for fast distribution of data and applications.
Amazon RDS is a managed relational database service supporting various engines like MySQL and PostgreSQL.
Amazon EBS (Elastic Block Store) provides persistent block storage volumes for EC2.
Amazon SQS (Simple Queue Service) enables message queuing for decoupling microservices.
Amazon SNS (Simple Notification Service) is a messaging service for A2A and A2P communication.
Amazon ECS (Elastic Container Service) is a managed container orchestration service.
Amazon EKS (Elastic Kubernetes Service) runs Kubernetes without managing your own cluster.
Amazon CloudWatch monitors and logs metrics for AWS resources and apps.
AWS CloudTrail records account activity across AWS infrastructure.
AWS CloudFormation automates infrastructure as code using JSON/YAML templates.
AWS Elastic Beanstalk deploys and manages web applications easily.
AWS Auto Scaling automatically adjusts capacity for optimal performance and cost.
Amazon API Gateway builds, deploys, and manages secure APIs at scale.
AWS Fargate runs containers without managing servers or clusters.
Amazon Athena is an interactive query service to analyze data in Amazon S3 using SQL.
AWS Glue is a serverless data integration service to prepare and transform data.
AWS CodePipeline automates the release process for continuous delivery.
AWS CodeBuild is a fully managed build service in the CI/CD process.
AWS CodeDeploy automates code deployments to any instance.
Amazon Lightsail provides simplified cloud servers, storage, and networking.
Amazon Redshift is a fast, scalable data warehouse in the cloud.
Amazon Kinesis processes real-time streaming data at massive scale.
Amazon QuickSight is a cloud-scale business intelligence service.
AWS Step Functions coordinate distributed applications with visual workflows.
AWS WAF (Web Application Firewall) protects web apps from common exploits.
AWS Shield protects applications from DDoS attacks.
AWS Secrets Manager securely manages secrets like API keys and passwords.
AWS Systems Manager gives visibility and control of infrastructure on AWS.
AWS Cloud9 is a cloud-based IDE for writing, running, and debugging code.
AWS Certificate Manager provisions, manages, and deploys SSL/TLS certificates.
AWS ELB automatically distributes incoming application traffic across multiple targets.
An Elastic IP address is a static IPv4 address designed for dynamic cloud computing.
AWS CloudShell is a browser-based shell to manage AWS resources.
AWS Outposts brings AWS infrastructure and services on-premises.
AWS Direct Connect establishes a dedicated network connection to AWS.
AWS AppSync builds GraphQL APIs by handling data querying and updating.
Amazon EventBridge is a serverless event bus that connects applications using events.
Amazon Inspector is an automated security assessment service.
Amazon Macie uses machine learning to discover, classify, and protect sensitive data in AWS.
Amazon Textract automatically extracts text and data from scanned documents.
Amazon Comprehend is a natural language processing (NLP) service using ML.
Amazon Rekognition adds image and video analysis to your apps using deep learning.
Amazon Lex builds conversational interfaces using voice and text.
Amazon Polly turns text into lifelike speech using deep learning.
